## 사건 정보

## 판결문 요약


689 S.W.2d 559 (1985)
286 Ark. 133
Dennis GLICK, Petitioner,
v.
STATE of Arkansas, Respondent.
No. CR 84-56.
Supreme Court of Arkansas.
May 20, 1985.
*561 Dennis Glick, pro se.
Steve Clark, Atty. Gen., Little Rock, for respondent.
PER CURIAM.
Petitioner Dennis Glick was found guilty by a jury of first degree escape, kidnapping and theft of property. He was sentenced as a habitual offender with eleven prior felony convictions to terms of 20 years, life and 20 years respectively. We affirmed the judgments and convictions but set aside an order which had held that the sentences were to be served consecutive to other sentences which petitioner was already serving. Glick v. State, 283 Ark. 412, 677 S.W.2d 844 (1984). Petitioner now seeks permission to proceed in circuit court for postconviction relief pursuant to Ark.R. Crim.P. 37. He also requests at public expense a copy of the transcript of his trial. This Court denied a motion for transcript in this case on March 11, 1985, because petitioner did not demonstrate a compelling need for a transcript. Petitioner has not established a compelling need in this petition.
Petitioner contends that the trial court erred in allowing him to be tried over counsel's objection in the white uniform of a prison inmate. We first note that the issue which was raised at trial could have been raised on appeal, but was not.
